node.title: Covid-19 update: 56 new community cases in New Zealand today
node.description: There are 56 new cases of Covid-19 in the community today, the Ministry of Health has confirmed.
node.content:
["There are 56 new cases of Covid-19 in the community today, the Ministry of Health has confirmed.", "", "
\nPhoto: 123rf.com\n
", "In a statement, the Ministry said the new cases were in Auckland (42), Waikato (4), Bay of Plenty (6), Rotorua (2), Taranaki (1), and Tair\u0101whiti (1).", "The one new case in Taranaki is linked to the Eltham cluster and is understood to have been self-isolating during their infectious period.", "The two Rotorua cases are household contacts, and three of the six new cases in the Bay of Plenty today have also been linked to earlier cases.", "There are 48 people with the coronavirus in hospital, including seven in ICU.", "There were also four cases reported at the border today.", "There have now been 10,432 cases in the current community outbreak and 13,278 since the pandemic began.", "After three detections of Covid-19 in wastewater samples collected in Napier this month, the virus was not detected in a sample collected on 21 December. A follow up sample has been collected for analysis.", "There were no other new, unexpected wastewater results to report.", "Napier Mayor Kirsten Wise said the previous wastewater results were a reminder for residents to not be complacent.", "\"Potentially there has been some complacency creep in, it's a time of the year when people are pretty busy doing everything they need to do in preparation for the Christmas break.", "\"Certainly when we have these positive wastewater test results, it's an good reminder and a good prompt for people that it's important to go and get tested.\"", "Wise said it was important for people to get vaccinated, with Napier's first-dose rate at about 93 percent and 87 percent for double doses of the eligible population.", "There were 23,016 vaccine doses given yesterday, including 1578 first doses, 7258 second doses, 807 third primary doses and 13,373 booster doses. The Ministry said 95 percent of eligible people in New Zealand have had their first dose and 91 percent are double-dosed.", "\"Eleven DHBs are now fully vaccinated to 90 percent or higher, with Hawke's Bay and Waikato next in line on 89 percent, with 823 and 2147 doses left to go respectively before reaching this milestone.\""]
